SENT.plain: To define the mucin secretion of Barrett's esophagus, 132 biopsy specimens from 37 patients were studied with histochemical stains for mucins
Columnar mucous cells contained largely neutral mucins, but scattered cells in over 70% of the biopsies also produced sialomucins and sulfomucins
Goblet cells contained sialomucins, sulfomucins, or both
The distribution and relative proportions of mucins varied considerably among biopsies and among patients
Barrett's esophagus histochemically represents a heterogeneous, partially differentiated epithelium analogous to incomplete intestinal metaplasia of gastric mucosa
